param/FW_AIRSPD_STALL/longDesc: The stall airspeed (calibrated airspeed) of the vehicle. It is used for airspeed sensor failure detection and for the control surface scaling airspeed limits.
param/FW_ECO_AD_THRLD/longDesc: Eco mode is disabled if the airspeed setpoint is above this value. APX4 custom parameter.
param/FW_ECO_ALT_ERR_O/shortDesc: Eco TECS mode max altitude overshoot
param/FW_ECO_ALT_ERR_O/longDesc: Eco mode is disabled if the current altitude is more than this value above the setpoint. APX4 custom parameter.
param/FW_ECO_ALT_ERR_U/shortDesc: Eco TECS mode max altitude undershoot
param/FW_ECO_ALT_ERR_U/longDesc: Eco mode is disabled if the current altitude is more than this value below the setpoint. APX4 custom parameter.
param/FW_ECO_ALT_MIN/longDesc: Eco mode is disabled if the current altitude is below this relative altitude to home. APX4 custom parameter.
param/FW_GND_SPD_MIN/longDesc: The controller will increase the commanded airspeed to maintain this minimum groundspeed to the next waypoint.
param/FW_T_ALT_TC_E/shortDesc: Eco Mode: Altitude error time constant
param/FW_T_ALT_TC_E/longDesc: Normally larger than FW_T_ALT_TC to have looser altitude control and in turn less throttle changes. APX4 custom parameter.
param/FW_T_CLMB_MAX/longDesc: This is the best climb rate that the aircraft can achieve with the throttle set to THR_MAX and the airspeed set to the default value. For electric aircraft make sure this number can be achieved towards the end of flight when the battery voltage has reduced. The setting of this parameter can be checked by commanding a positive altitude change of 100m in loiter, RTL or guided mode. If the throttle required to climb is close to THR_MAX and the aircraft is maintaining airspeed, then this parameter is set correctly. If the airspeed starts to reduce, then the parameter is set to high, and if the throttle demand required to climb and maintain speed is noticeably less than FW_THR_MAX, then either FW_T_CLMB_MAX should be increased or FW_THR_MAX reduced.
param/FW_T_CLMB_R_SP/longDesc: The default rate at which the vehicle will climb in autonomous modes to achieve altitude setpoints. In manual modes this defines the maximum rate at which the altitude setpoint can be increased.
param/FW_T_CLMB_R_SP_E/longDesc: The rate at which the vehicle will climb in autonomous modes to achieve altitude setpoints in Eco mode. APX4 custom parameter.
param/FW_T_I_GAIN_PIT/longDesc: This is the integrator gain on the pitch part of the control loop. Increasing this gain increases the speed at which speed and height offsets are trimmed out, but reduces damping and increases overshoot. Set this value to zero to completely disable all integrator action.
param/FW_T_I_GAIN_THR/longDesc: This is the integrator gain on the throttle part of the control loop. Increasing this gain increases the speed at which speed and height offsets are trimmed out, but reduces damping and increases overshoot. Set this value to zero to completely disable all integrator action.
param/FW_T_PTCH_DAMP/longDesc: This is the damping gain for the pitch demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in height. The default value of 0.0 will work well provided the pitch to servo controller has been tuned properly.
param/FW_T_RLL2THR/longDesc: Increasing this gain turn increases the amount of throttle that will be used to compensate for the additional drag created by turning. Ideally this should be set to  approximately 10 x the extra sink rate in m/s created by a 45 degree bank turn. Increase this gain if the aircraft initially loses energy in turns and reduce if the aircraft initially gains energy in turns. Efficient high aspect-ratio aircraft (eg powered sailplanes) can use a lower value, whereas inefficient low aspect-ratio models (eg delta wings) can use a higher value.
param/FW_T_SEB_R_FF/shortDesc: Specific total energy balance rate feedforward gain
param/FW_T_SINK_MAX/longDesc: This sets the maximum descent rate that the controller will use. If this value is too large, the aircraft can over-speed on descent. This should be set to a value that can be achieved without exceeding the lower pitch angle limit and without over-speeding the aircraft.
param/FW_T_SINK_MIN/longDesc: This is the sink rate of the aircraft with the throttle set to THR_MIN and flown at the same airspeed as used to measure FW_T_CLMB_MAX.
param/FW_T_SINK_R_SP/longDesc: The default rate at which the vehicle will sink in autonomous modes to achieve altitude setpoints. In manual modes this defines the maximum rate at which the altitude setpoint can be decreased.
param/FW_T_SPDWEIGHT/longDesc: This parameter adjusts the amount of weighting that the pitch control applies to speed vs height errors. Setting it to 0.0 will cause the pitch control to control height and ignore speed errors. This will normally improve height accuracy but give larger airspeed errors. Setting it to 2.0 will cause the pitch control loop to control speed and ignore height errors. This will normally reduce airspeed errors, but give larger height errors. The default value of 1.0 allows the pitch control to simultaneously control height and speed. Note to Glider Pilots - set this parameter to 2.0 (The glider will adjust its pitch angle to maintain airspeed, ignoring changes in height).
param/FW_T_SPD_OMEGA/longDesc: This is the cross-over frequency (in radians/second) of the complementary filter used to fuse longitudinal acceleration and airspeed to obtain an improved airspeed estimate. Increasing this frequency weights the solution more towards use of the airspeed sensor, whilst reducing it weights the solution more towards use of the accelerometer data.
param/FW_T_STE_R_TC/shortDesc: Specific total energy rate first order filter time constant
param/FW_T_STE_R_TC/longDesc: This filter is applied to the specific total energy rate used for throttle damping.
param/FW_T_TAS_R_TC/shortDesc: True airspeed rate first order filter time constant
param/FW_T_TAS_R_TC/longDesc: This filter is applied to the true airspeed rate.
param/FW_T_THR_DAMP/longDesc: This is the damping gain for the throttle demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in speed and height.
param/FW_T_VERT_ACC/longDesc: This is the maximum vertical acceleration (in m/s/s) either up or down that the controller will use to correct speed or height errors. The default value of 7 m/s/s (equivalent to +- 0.7 g) allows for reasonably aggressive pitch changes if required to recover from under-speed conditions.
param/FW_WIND_ARSP_SC/longDesc: Multiplying this factor with the current absolute wind estimate gives the airspeed offset added to the minimum airspeed setpoint limit. This helps to make the system more robust against disturbances (turbulence) in high wind. The airspeed increase is limited to 3 m/s. APX4 custom parameter. airspeed_min_adjusted = FW_AIRSPD_MIN + FW_WIND_ARSP_SC * wind.length()
param/FD_ACT_EN/longDesc: If enabled, failure detector will verify that for motors, a minimum amount of ESC current per throttle level is being consumed. Otherwise this indicates an motor failure.
param/FD_ACT_MOT_C2T/longDesc: Motor failure triggers only below this current value
param/FD_ACT_MOT_THR/longDesc: Motor failure triggers only above this throttle value.
param/FD_ACT_MOT_TOUT/longDesc: Motor failure triggers only if the throttle threshold and the current to throttle threshold are violated for this time.
param/FD_BAT_EN/shortDesc: Enable checks on smart batteries that report readiness or faults
param/FD_BAT_EN/longDesc: If enabled, failure detector will verify that all the batteries are in nominal mode and no faults were detected by the batteries. Timeout for receiving a nominal status report from the batteries after arming is 0.5s, if no feedback is received the failure detector will auto disarm the vehicle.
param/FD_ESCS_EN/shortDesc: Enable checks on ESCs that report their arming state
param/FD_ESCS_EN/longDesc: If enabled, failure detector will verify that all the ESCs have successfully armed when the vehicle has transitioned to the armed state. Timeout for receiving an acknowledgement from the ESCs is 0.3s, if no feedback is received the failure detector will auto disarm the vehicle.
param/FD_EXT_ATS_EN/shortDesc: Enable PWM input on for engaging failsafe from an external automatic trigger system (ATS)
param/FD_EXT_ATS_EN/longDesc: Enabled on either AUX5 or MAIN5 depending on board. External ATS is required by ASTM F3322-18.
param/FD_EXT_ATS_TRIG/shortDesc: The PWM threshold from external automatic trigger system for engaging failsafe
param/FD_EXT_ATS_TRIG/longDesc: External ATS is required by ASTM F3322-18.
param/FD_FAIL_P/longDesc: Maximum pitch angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag. The flag triggers flight termination (if @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM = 0), which sets outputs to their failsafe values. On takeoff the flag triggers lockdown (irrespective of @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM), which disarms motors but does not set outputs to failsafe values. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check
param/FD_FAIL_P_TTRI/longDesc: Seconds (decimal) that pitch has to exceed FD_FAIL_P before being considered as a failure.
param/FD_FAIL_R/longDesc: Maximum roll angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag. The flag triggers flight termination (if @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM = 0), which sets outputs to their failsafe values. On takeoff the flag triggers lockdown (irrespective of @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM), which disarms motors but does not set outputs to failsafe values. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check
param/FD_FAIL_R_TTRI/longDesc: Seconds (decimal) that roll has to exceed FD_FAIL_R before being considered as a failure.
param/FD_IMB_PROP_THR/longDesc: Value at which the imbalanced propeller metric (based on horizontal and vertical acceleration variance) triggers a failure Setting this value to 0 disables the feature.
param/FD_WIND_MAX/longDesc: Wind speed threshold above which the emergency action for high wind is triggered and enforced as long as the threshold is exceeded. A negative value disables the feature.
param/NAV_FT_ALT_M/values/0: Maintain constant altitude and track XY position only (2D tracking)
param/NAV_FT_ALT_M/values/1: Track target's altitude as well (3D tracking)
param/NAV_FT_ALT_M/longDesc: Maintain altitude or track target's altitude. When maintaining the altitude, the drone can crash into terrain when the target moves uphill. When tracking the target's altitude, the follow altitude NAV_MIN_FT_HT should be high enough to prevent terrain collisions due to GPS inaccuracies of the target.
param/NAV_FT_DST/longDesc: The distance in meters to follow the target at
param/NAV_FT_FS/longDesc: The side to follow the target from none         = 0 behind       = 1 front        = 2 front right  = 3 front left   = 4 mid right    = 5 mid left     = 6 behind right = 7 behind left  = 8
param/NAV_FT_RS/shortDesc: Dynamic filtering algorithm responsiveness to target movement
param/NAV_FT_RS/longDesc: lower values increase the responsiveness to changing long lat but also ignore less noise
param/NAV_MIN_FT_HT/longDesc: The minimum height in meters relative to home for following a target
param/GPS_1_GNSS/shortDesc: GNSS Systems for Primary GPS (integer bitmask)
param/GPS_1_GNSS/longDesc: This integer bitmask controls the set of GNSS systems used by the receiver. Check your receiver's documentation on how many systems are supported to be used in parallel. Currently this functionality is just implemented for u-blox receivers. When no bits are set, the receiver's default configuration should be used. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Use GPS (with QZSS) 1 : Use SBAS (multiple GPS augmentation systems) 2 : Use Galileo 3 : Use BeiDou 4 : Use GLONASS
param/GPS_1_PROTOCOL/longDesc: Select the GPS protocol over serial. Auto-detection will probe all protocols, and thus is a bit slower.
param/GPS_2_GNSS/shortDesc: GNSS Systems for Secondary GPS (integer bitmask)
param/GPS_2_GNSS/longDesc: This integer bitmask controls the set of GNSS systems used by the receiver. Check your receiver's documentation on how many systems are supported to be used in parallel. Currently this functionality is just implemented for u-blox receivers. When no bits are set, the receiver's default configuration should be used. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Use GPS (with QZSS) 1 : Use SBAS (multiple GPS augmentation systems) 2 : Use Galileo 3 : Use BeiDou 4 : Use GLONASS
param/GPS_2_PROTOCOL/longDesc: Select the GPS protocol over serial. Auto-detection will probe all protocols, and thus is a bit slower.
param/GPS_DUMP_COMM/longDesc: If this is set to 1, all GPS communication data will be published via uORB, and written to the log file as gps_dump message. If this is set to 2, the main GPS is configured to output RTCM data, which is then logged as gps_dump and can be used for PPK.
param/GPS_UBX_DYNMODEL/longDesc: u-blox receivers support different dynamic platform models to adjust the navigation engine to the expected application environment.
param/GPS_UBX_MODE/values/1: Heading (Rover With Moving Base UART1 Connected To Autopilot, UART2 Connected To Moving Base)
param/GPS_UBX_MODE/values/2: Moving Base (UART1 Connected To Autopilot, UART2 Connected To Rover)
param/GPS_UBX_MODE/values/3: Heading (Rover With Moving Base UART1 Connected to Autopilot Or Can Node At 921600)
param/GPS_UBX_MODE/values/4: Moving Base (Moving Base UART1 Connected to Autopilot Or Can Node At 921600)
param/GPS_UBX_MODE/longDesc: Select the u-blox configuration setup. Most setups will use the default, including RTK and dual GPS without heading. The Heading mode requires 2 F9P devices to be attached. The main GPS will act as rover and output heading information, whereas the secondary will act as moving base. Modes 1 and 2 require each F9P UART1 to be connected to the Autopilot. In addition, UART2 on the F9P units are connected to each other. Modes 3 and 4 only require UART1 on each F9P connected to the Autopilot or Can Node. UART RX DMA is required. RTK is still possible with this setup.
param/GPS_YAW_OFFSET/shortDesc: Heading/Yaw offset for dual antenna GPS
param/GPS_YAW_OFFSET/longDesc: Heading offset angle for dual antenna GPS setups that support heading estimation. Set this to 0 if the antennas are parallel to the forward-facing direction of the vehicle and the first antenna is in front. The offset angle increases clockwise. Set this to 90 if the first antenna is placed on the right side and the second on the left side of the vehicle.
param/PPS_CAP_ENABLE/longDesc: Enables the PPS capture module. This switches mode of FMU channel 7 to be the PPS input channel.
param/GF_ACTION/longDesc: Note: Setting this value to 4 enables flight termination, which will kill the vehicle on violation of the fence. Due to the inherent danger of this, this function is disabled using a software circuit breaker, which needs to be reset to 0 to really shut down the system.
param/GF_ALTMODE/values/1: Raw barometer altitude (assuming standard atmospheric pressure)
param/GF_ALTMODE/longDesc: Select which altitude (AMSL) source should be used for geofence calculations.
param/GF_COUNT/longDesc: Set how many subsequent position measurements outside of the fence are needed before geofence violation is triggered
param/GF_MAX_HOR_DIST/longDesc: Maximum horizontal distance in meters the vehicle can be from home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.
param/GF_MAX_VER_DIST/longDesc: Maximum vertical distance in meters the vehicle can be from home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.
param/GF_SOURCE/longDesc: Select which position source should be used. Selecting GPS instead of global position makes sure that there is no dependence on the position estimator 0 = global position, 1 = GPS
param/HTE_ACC_GATE/longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.
param/HTE_HT_ERR_INIT/longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.
param/HTE_HT_NOISE/longDesc: Reduce to make the hover thrust estimate more stable, increase if the real hover thrust is expected to change quickly over time.
param/HTE_THR_RANGE/longDesc: Defines the range of the hover thrust estimate around MPC_THR_HOVER. A value of 0.2 with MPC_THR_HOVER at 0.5 results in a range of [0.3, 0.7]. Set to a large value if the vehicle operates in varying physical conditions that affect the required hover thrust strongly (e.g. differently sized payloads).
param/HTE_VXY_THR/shortDesc: Horizontal velocity threshold for sensitivity reduction
param/HTE_VXY_THR/longDesc: Above this speed, the measurement noise is linearly increased to reduce the sensitivity of the estimator from biased measurement. Set to a low value on vehicles with large lifting surfaces.
param/HTE_VZ_THR/shortDesc: Vertical velocity threshold for sensitivity reduction
param/HTE_VZ_THR/longDesc: Above this speed, the measurement noise is linearly increased to reduce the sensitivity of the estimator from biased measurement. Set to a low value on vehicles affected by air drag when climbing or descending.
param/ISBD_READ_INT/shortDesc: Satellite radio read interval. Only required to be nonzero if data is not sent using a ring call
param/ISBD_STACK_TIME/shortDesc: Time the Iridium driver will wait for additional mavlink messages to combine them into one SBD message
param/LNDFW_AIRSPD_MAX/longDesc: Maximum airspeed allowed in the landed state
param/LNDFW_VEL_XY_MAX/shortDesc: Fixed-wing land detector: Max horizontal velocity threshold
param/LNDFW_VEL_XY_MAX/longDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state. A factor of 0.7 is applied in case of airspeed-less flying (either because no sensor is present or sensor data got invalid in flight).
param/LNDFW_VEL_Z_MAX/shortDesc: Fixed-wing land detector: Max vertiacal velocity threshold
param/LNDFW_VEL_Z_MAX/longDesc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state. A factor of 0.7 is applied in case of airspeed-less flying (either because no sensor is present or sensor data got invalid in flight).
param/LNDFW_XYACC_MAX/shortDesc: Fixed-wing land detector: Max horizontal acceleration
param/LNDFW_XYACC_MAX/longDesc: Maximum horizontal (x,y body axes) acceleration allowed in the landed state
param/LNDMC_ALT_GND/longDesc: The height above ground below which ground effect creates barometric altitude errors. A negative value indicates no ground effect.
param/LNDMC_ALT_MAX/longDesc: The system will obey this limit as a hard altitude limit. This setting will be consolidated with the GF_MAX_VER_DIST parameter. A negative value indicates no altitude limitation.
param/LNDMC_ROT_MAX/longDesc: Maximum allowed angular velocity around each axis allowed in the landed state.
param/LNDMC_TRIG_TIME/longDesc: Total time it takes to go through all three land detection stages: ground contact, maybe landed, landed when all necessary conditions are constantly met.
param/LNDMC_XY_VEL_MAX/longDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state
param/LNDMC_Z_VEL_MAX/longDesc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state
param/LND_FLIGHT_T_HI/longDesc: Total flight time of this autopilot. Higher 32 bits of the value. Flight time in microseconds = (LND_FLIGHT_T_HI << 32) | LND_FLIGHT_T_LO.
param/LND_FLIGHT_T_LO/longDesc: Total flight time of this autopilot. Lower 32 bits of the value. Flight time in microseconds = (LND_FLIGHT_T_HI << 32) | LND_FLIGHT_T_LO.
param/LTEST_SENS_POS_X/shortDesc: X Position of IRLOCK in body frame (forward)
param/LTEST_SENS_POS_Y/shortDesc: Y Position of IRLOCK in body frame (right)
param/LTEST_SENS_POS_Z/shortDesc: Z Position of IRLOCK in body frame (downward)
param/LTEST_SENS_ROT/shortDesc: Rotation of IRLOCK sensor relative to airframe
param/LTEST_ACC_UNC/longDesc: Variance of acceleration measurement used for landing target position prediction. Higher values results in tighter following of the measurements and more lenient outlier rejection
param/LTEST_MEAS_UNC/longDesc: Variance of the landing target measurement from the driver. Higher values result in less aggressive following of the measurement and a smoother output as well as fewer rejected measurements.
param/LTEST_MODE/longDesc: Configure the mode of the landing target. Depending on the mode, the landing target observations are used differently to aid position estimation. Mode Moving:     The landing target may be moving around while in the field of view of the vehicle. Landing target measurements are not used to aid positioning. Mode Stationary: The landing target is stationary. Measured velocity w.r.t. the landing target is used to aid velocity estimation.
param/LTEST_POS_UNC_IN/longDesc: Initial variance of the relative landing target position in x and y direction
param/LTEST_SCALE_X/shortDesc: Scale factor for sensor measurements in sensor x axis
param/LTEST_SCALE_X/longDesc: Landing target x measurements are scaled by this factor before being used
param/LTEST_SCALE_Y/shortDesc: Scale factor for sensor measurements in sensor y axis
param/LTEST_SCALE_Y/longDesc: Landing target y measurements are scaled by this factor before being used
param/LTEST_VEL_UNC_IN/longDesc: Initial variance of the relative landing target velocity in x and y directions
param/LPE_ACC_XY/longDesc: Data sheet noise density = 150ug/sqrt(Hz) = 0.0015 m/s^2/sqrt(Hz) Larger than data sheet to account for tilt error.
param/LPE_BAR_Z/shortDesc: Barometric presssure altitude z standard deviation
param/LPE_EPH_MAX/shortDesc: Max EPH allowed for GPS initialization
param/LPE_EPV_MAX/shortDesc: Max EPV allowed for GPS initialization
param/LPE_FAKE_ORIGIN/shortDesc: Enable publishing of a fake global position (e.g for AUTO missions using Optical Flow)
param/LPE_FAKE_ORIGIN/longDesc: By initializing the estimator to the LPE_LAT/LON parameters when global information is unavailable
param/LPE_FGYRO_HP/shortDesc: Flow gyro high pass filter cut off frequency
param/LPE_FLW_OFF_Z/shortDesc: Optical flow z offset from center
param/LPE_FLW_RR/shortDesc: Optical flow angular velocity noise gain
param/LPE_FUSION/bitmask/0: fuse GPS, requires GPS for alt. init
param/LPE_FUSION/longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Set to true to fuse GPS data if available, also requires GPS for altitude init 1 : Set to true to fuse optical flow data if available 2 : Set to true to fuse vision position 3 : Set to true to enable landing target 4 : Set to true to fuse land detector 5 : Set to true to publish AGL as local position down component 6 : Set to true to enable flow gyro compensation 7 : Set to true to enable baro fusion default (145 - GPS, baro, land detector)
param/LPE_GPS_VXY/longDesc: EPV used if greater than this value.
param/LPE_GPS_XY/shortDesc: Minimum GPS xy standard deviation, uses reported EPH if greater
param/LPE_GPS_Z/shortDesc: Minimum GPS z standard deviation, uses reported EPV if greater
param/LPE_LAND_VXY/shortDesc: Land detector xy velocity standard deviation
param/LPE_LAT/shortDesc: Local origin latitude for nav w/o GPS
param/LPE_LDR_OFF_Z/shortDesc: Lidar z offset from center of vehicle +down
param/LPE_LON/shortDesc: Local origin longitude for nav w/o GPS
param/LPE_LT_COV/shortDesc: Minimum landing target standard covariance, uses reported covariance if greater
param/LPE_PN_P/longDesc: Increase to trust measurements more. Decrease to trust model more.
param/LPE_PN_T/shortDesc: Terrain random walk noise density, hilly/outdoor (0.1), flat/Indoor (0.001)
param/LPE_PN_V/longDesc: Increase to trust measurements more. Decrease to trust model more.
param/LPE_SNR_OFF_Z/shortDesc: Sonar z offset from center of vehicle +down
param/LPE_T_MAX_GRADE/shortDesc: Terrain maximum percent grade, hilly/outdoor (100 = 45 deg), flat/Indoor (0 = 0 deg)
param/LPE_T_MAX_GRADE/longDesc: Used to calculate increased terrain random walk nosie due to movement.
param/LPE_VIS_DELAY/longDesc: Set to zero to enable automatic compensation from measurement timestamps
param/LPE_VXY_PUB/shortDesc: Required velocity xy standard deviation to publish position
param/LPE_Z_PUB/shortDesc: Required z standard deviation to publish altitude/ terrain
param/MAV_FWDEXTSP/longDesc: If set to 1 incoming external setpoint messages will be directly forwarded to the controllers if in offboard control mode
param/MAV_HASH_CHK_EN/longDesc: Disabling the parameter hash check functionality will make the mavlink instance stream parameters continuously.
param/MAV_HB_FORW_EN/longDesc: The mavlink heartbeat message will not be forwarded if this parameter is set to 'disabled'. The main reason for disabling heartbeats to be forwarded is because they confuse dronekit.
param/MAV_ODOM_LP/longDesc: If set, it gets the data from 'vehicle_visual_odometry' instead of 'vehicle_odometry' serving as a loopback of the received ODOMETRY messages on the Mavlink receiver.
param/MAV_PROTO_VER/values/0: Default to 1, switch to 2 if GCS sends version 2
param/MAV_RADIO_TOUT/shortDesc: Timeout in seconds for the RADIO_STATUS reports coming in
param/MAV_RADIO_TOUT/longDesc: If the connected radio stops reporting RADIO_STATUS for a certain time, a warning is triggered and, if MAV_X_RADIO_CTL is enabled, the software-flow control is reset.
param/MAV_SIK_RADIO_ID/longDesc: When non-zero the MAVLink app will attempt to configure the SiK radio to this ID and re-set the parameter to 0. If the value is negative it will reset the complete radio config to factory defaults. Only applies if this mavlink instance is going through a SiK radio
param/MAV_TYPE/values/6: Operator control unit / ground control station
param/MAV_TYPE/values/19: Two-rotor VTOL using control surfaces in vertical operation in addition. Tailsitter.
param/MAV_TYPE/values/20: Quad-rotor VTOL using a V-shaped quad config in vertical operation. Tailsitter.
param/MAV_USEHILGPS/shortDesc: Use/Accept HIL GPS message even if not in HIL mode
param/MAV_USEHILGPS/longDesc: If set to 1 incoming HIL GPS messages are parsed.
param/MBE_ENABLE/longDesc: This enables continuous calibration of the magnetometers before takeoff using gyro data.
param/MBE_LEARN_GAIN/longDesc: Increase to make the estimator more responsive Decrease to make the estimator more robust to noise
param/MAN_ARM_GESTURE/longDesc: This determines if moving the left stick to the lower right arms and to the lower left disarms the vehicle.
param/FW_GPSF_LT/longDesc: The time in seconds the system should do open loop loiter and wait for GPS recovery before it starts descending. Set to 0 to disable. Roll angle is set to FW_GPSF_R. Does only apply for fixed-wing vehicles or VTOLs with NAV_FORCE_VT set to 0.
param/FW_GPSF_R/longDesc: Roll in degrees during the loiter after the vehicle has lost GPS in an auto mode (e.g. mission or loiter). Does only apply for fixed-wing vehicles or VTOLs with NAV_FORCE_VT set to 0.
param/MIS_DIST_1WP/shortDesc: Maximal horizontal distance from home to first waypoint
param/MIS_DIST_1WP/longDesc: Failsafe check to prevent running mission stored from previous flight at a new takeoff location. Set a value of zero or less to disable. The mission will not be started if the current waypoint is more distant than MIS_DIST_1WP from the home position.
param/MIS_DIST_WPS/longDesc: Failsafe check to prevent running missions which are way too big. Set a value of zero or less to disable. The mission will not be started if any distance between two subsequent waypoints is greater than MIS_DIST_WPS.
param/MIS_FLIGHT_TIME/longDesc: Check to prevent missions that would take too long. Set a value of zero to disable. The mission will not be started if the total flight time is greater than MIS_FLIGHT_TIME. The default is 3540 seconds (59 minutes).
param/MIS_LTRMIN_ALT/longDesc: This is the minimum altitude the system will always obey. The intent is to stay out of ground effect. set to -1, if there shouldn't be a minimum loiter altitude
param/MIS_MNT_YAW_CTL/shortDesc: Enable yaw control of the mount. (Only affects multicopters and ROI mission items)
param/MIS_MNT_YAW_CTL/longDesc: If enabled, yaw commands will be sent to the mount and the vehicle will follow its heading towards the flight direction. If disabled, the vehicle will yaw towards the ROI.
param/MIS_TAKEOFF_ALT/longDesc: This is the minimum altitude the system will take off to.
param/MIS_TKO_LAND_REQ/values/0: Do not require a mission takeoff nor a mission landing
param/MIS_TKO_LAND_REQ/values/1: Require a mission takeoff, do not require a mission landing
param/MIS_TKO_LAND_REQ/values/2: Do not require a mission takeoff, require a mission landing
param/MIS_TKO_LAND_REQ/values/3: Require a mission takeoff and a mission landing
param/MIS_TKO_LAND_REQ/values/4: Require a mission takeoff and a mission landing, or neither of both
param/MIS_TKO_LAND_REQ/values/5: Same as previous, but require a landing if in air and no valid VTOL landing approach is present
param/MIS_TKO_LAND_REQ/longDesc: If set, the mission feasibility checker will check for a planned misson landing at the end of the mission.
param/MIS_YAW_ERR/shortDesc: Max yaw error in degrees needed for waypoint heading acceptance
param/MIS_YAW_TMT/shortDesc: Time in seconds we wait on reaching target heading at a waypoint if it is forced
param/MIS_YAW_TMT/longDesc: If set > 0 it will ignore the target heading for normal waypoint acceptance. If the waypoint forces the heading the timeout will matter. For example on VTOL forwards transition. Mainly useful for VTOLs that have less yaw authority and might not reach target yaw in wind. Disabled by default.
param/NAV_ACC_RAD/longDesc: Default acceptance radius, overridden by acceptance radius of waypoint if set. For fixed wing the L1 turning distance is used for horizontal acceptance.
param/NAV_FORCE_VT/shortDesc: Force VTOL mode takeoff and land
param/NAV_FW_ALTL_RAD/shortDesc: FW Altitude Acceptance Radius before a landing
param/NAV_FW_ALTL_RAD/longDesc: Altitude acceptance used for the last waypoint before a fixed-wing landing. This is usually smaller than the standard vertical acceptance because close to the ground higher accuracy is required.
param/NAV_LOITER_RAD/longDesc: Default value of loiter radius for missions, Hold mode, Return mode, etc. (fixedwing only).
param/NAV_TRAFF_AVOID/longDesc: Enabling this will allow the system to respond to transponder data from e.g. ADSB transponders
param/NAV_TRAFF_A_RADM/shortDesc: Set NAV TRAFFIC AVOID RADIUS MANNED
param/NAV_TRAFF_A_RADM/longDesc: Defines the Radius where NAV TRAFFIC AVOID is Called For Manned Aviation
param/NAV_TRAFF_A_RADU/longDesc: Defines the Radius where NAV TRAFFIC AVOID is Called For Unmanned Aviation
param/MC_AIRMODE/longDesc: The air-mode enables the mixer to increase the total thrust of the multirotor in order to keep attitude and rate control even at low and high throttle. This function should be disabled during tuning as it will help the controller to diverge if the closed-loop is unstable (i.e. the vehicle is not tuned yet). Enabling air-mode for yaw requires the use of an arming switch.
param/MOT_ORDERING/longDesc: Determines the motor ordering. This can be used for example in combination with a 4-in-1 ESC that assumes a motor ordering which is different from PX4. ONLY supported for Quads. When changing this, make sure to test the motor response without props first.
param/MNT_DO_STAB/longDesc: Set to true for servo gimbal, false for passthrough. This is required for a gimbal which is not capable of stabilizing itself and relies on the IMU's attitude estimation.
param/MNT_MAN_PITCH/shortDesc: Auxiliary channel to control pitch (in AUX input or manual mode)
param/MNT_MAN_ROLL/shortDesc: Auxiliary channel to control roll (in AUX input or manual mode)
param/MNT_MAN_YAW/shortDesc: Auxiliary channel to control yaw (in AUX input or manual mode)
param/MNT_MAV_COMPID/shortDesc: Mavlink Component ID of the mount
param/MNT_MAV_COMPID/longDesc: If MNT_MODE_OUT is MAVLink protocol v2, mount configure/control commands will be sent with this component ID.
param/MNT_MAV_SYSID/shortDesc: Mavlink System ID of the mount
param/MNT_MAV_SYSID/longDesc: If MNT_MODE_OUT is MAVLink gimbal protocol v1, mount configure/control commands will be sent with this target ID.
param/MNT_MODE_IN/longDesc: RC uses the AUX input channels (see MNT_MAN_* parameters), MAVLINK_ROI uses the MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI Mavlink message, and MAVLINK_DO_MOUNT the MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONFIGURE and MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL messages to control a mount.
param/MNT_MODE_OUT/longDesc: AUX uses the mixer output Control Group #2. MAVLINK uses the MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONFIGURE and MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL MavLink messages to control a mount (set MNT_MAV_SYSID & MNT_MAV_COMPID)
param/MNT_OB_LOCK_MODE/shortDesc: Mixer value for selecting a locking mode
param/MNT_OB_LOCK_MODE/longDesc: if required for the gimbal (only in AUX output mode)
param/MNT_OB_NORM_MODE/shortDesc: Mixer value for selecting normal mode
param/MNT_OB_NORM_MODE/longDesc: if required by the gimbal (only in AUX output mode)
param/MNT_OFF_PITCH/shortDesc: Offset for pitch channel output in degrees
param/MNT_OFF_ROLL/shortDesc: Offset for roll channel output in degrees
param/MNT_OFF_YAW/shortDesc: Offset for yaw channel output in degrees
param/MNT_RANGE_PITCH/shortDesc: Range of pitch channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)
param/MNT_RANGE_ROLL/shortDesc: Range of roll channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)
param/MNT_RANGE_YAW/shortDesc: Range of yaw channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)
param/MNT_RATE_PITCH/shortDesc: Angular pitch rate for manual input in degrees/second
param/MNT_RATE_PITCH/longDesc: Full stick input [-1..1] translats to [-pitch rate..pitch rate].
param/MNT_RATE_YAW/shortDesc: Angular yaw rate for manual input in degrees/second
param/MNT_RATE_YAW/longDesc: Full stick input [-1..1] translats to [-yaw rate..yaw rate].
param/MNT_RC_IN_MODE/shortDesc: Input mode for RC gimbal input
param/MC_PITCHRATE_MAX/longDesc: Limit for pitch rate in manual and auto modes (except acro). Has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation. This is not only limited by the vehicle's properties, but also by the maximum measurement rate of the gyro.
param/MC_PITCH_P/longDesc: Pitch proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.
param/MC_ROLLRATE_MAX/longDesc: Limit for roll rate in manual and auto modes (except acro). Has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation. This is not only limited by the vehicle's properties, but also by the maximum measurement rate of the gyro.
param/MC_ROLL_P/longDesc: Roll proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.
param/MC_YAW_P/longDesc: Yaw proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.
param/MC_YAW_WEIGHT/longDesc: A fraction [0,1] deprioritizing yaw compared to roll and pitch in non-linear attitude control. Deprioritizing yaw is necessary because multicopters have much less control authority in yaw compared to the other axes and it makes sense because yaw is not critical for stable hovering or 3D navigation. For yaw control tuning use MC_YAW_P. This ratio has no inpact on the yaw gain.
param/MPC_YAWRAUTO_MAX/shortDesc: Max yaw rate in auto mode
param/MPC_YAWRAUTO_MAX/longDesc: Limit the rate of change of the yaw setpoint in autonomous mode to avoid large control output and mixer saturation.
param/CP_DELAY/shortDesc: Average delay of the range sensor message plus the tracking delay of the position controller in seconds
param/CP_DIST/shortDesc: Minimum distance the vehicle should keep to all obstacles
param/CP_DIST/longDesc: Only used in Position mode. Collision avoidance is disabled by setting this parameter to a negative value
param/CP_GO_NO_DATA/shortDesc: Boolean to allow moving into directions where there is no sensor data (outside FOV)
param/CP_GUIDE_ANG/shortDesc: Angle left/right from the commanded setpoint by which the collision prevention algorithm can choose to change the setpoint direction
param/MC_MAN_TILT_TAU/shortDesc: Manual tilt input filter time constant
param/MC_MAN_TILT_TAU/longDesc: Setting this parameter to 0 disables the filter
param/MPC_ACC_DOWN_MAX/shortDesc: Maximum vertical acceleration in velocity controlled modes down
param/MPC_ACC_HOR/shortDesc: Acceleration for auto and for manual
param/MPC_ACC_HOR/longDesc: Note: In manual, this parameter is only used in MPC_POS_MODE 4.
param/MPC_ACC_HOR_MAX/shortDesc: Maximum horizontal acceleration for auto mode and for manual mode
param/MPC_ACC_HOR_MAX/longDesc: MPC_POS_MODE 1 just deceleration 3 acceleration and deceleration 4 just acceleration
param/MPC_ACC_UP_MAX/shortDesc: Maximum vertical acceleration in velocity controlled modes upward
param/MPC_ALT_MODE/longDesc: Set to 0 to control height relative to the earth frame origin. This origin may move up and down in flight due to sensor drift. Set to 1 to control height relative to estimated distance to ground. The vehicle will move up and down with terrain height variation. Requires a distance to ground sensor. The height controller will revert to using height above origin if the distance to ground estimate becomes invalid as indicated by the local_position.distance_bottom_valid message being false. Set to 2 to control height relative to ground (requires a distance sensor) when stationary and relative to earth frame origin when moving horizontally. The speed threshold is controlled by the MPC_HOLD_MAX_XY parameter.
param/MPC_HOLD_DZ/shortDesc: Deadzone of sticks where position hold is enabled
param/MPC_HOLD_MAX_XY/shortDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)
param/MPC_HOLD_MAX_Z/shortDesc: Maximum vertical velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)
param/MPC_JERK_AUTO/longDesc: Limit the maximum jerk of the vehicle (how fast the acceleration can change). A lower value leads to smoother vehicle motions, but it also limits its agility.
param/MPC_JERK_MAX/longDesc: Limit the maximum jerk of the vehicle (how fast the acceleration can change). A lower value leads to smoother vehicle motions, but it also limits its agility (how fast it can change directions or break). Setting this to the maximum value essentially disables the limit. Note: This is only used when MPC_POS_MODE is set to a smoothing mode 3 or 4.
param/MPC_LAND_ALT1/shortDesc: Altitude for 1. step of slow landing (descend)
param/MPC_LAND_ALT1/longDesc: Below this altitude descending velocity gets limited to a value between "MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_DN" (or "MPC_Z_V_AUTO_DN") and "MPC_LAND_SPEED" Value needs to be higher than "MPC_LAND_ALT2"
param/MPC_LAND_ALT2/shortDesc: Altitude for 2. step of slow landing (landing)
param/MPC_LAND_ALT2/longDesc: Below this altitude descending velocity gets limited to "MPC_LAND_SPEED" Value needs to be lower than "MPC_LAND_ALT1"
param/MPC_LAND_ALT3/shortDesc: Altitude for 3. step of slow landing
param/MPC_LAND_ALT3/longDesc: Below this altitude descending velocity gets limited to "MPC_LAND_CRWL", if LIDAR available. No effect if LIDAR not available
param/MPC_LAND_CRWL/shortDesc: Land crawl descend rate. Used below
param/MPC_LAND_RC_HELP/shortDesc: Enable user assisted descent speed for autonomous land routine
param/MPC_LAND_RC_HELP/longDesc: When enabled, descent speed will be: stick full up - 0 stick centered - MPC_LAND_SPEED stick full down - 2 * MPC_LAND_SPEED
param/MPC_MANTHR_MIN/longDesc: Minimum vertical thrust. It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust. With MC_AIRMODE set to 1, this can safely be set to 0.
param/MPC_MAN_TILT_MAX/shortDesc: Maximal tilt angle in manual or altitude mode
param/MPC_MAN_Y_TAU/shortDesc: Manual yaw rate input filter time constant
param/MPC_MAN_Y_TAU/longDesc: Setting this parameter to 0 disables the filter
param/MPC_POS_MODE/longDesc: The supported sub-modes are: 0 Simple position control where sticks map directly to velocity setpoints without smoothing. Useful for velocity control tuning. 3 Smooth position control with maximum acceleration and jerk limits based on jerk optimized trajectory generator (different algorithm than 1). 4 Smooth position control where sticks map to acceleration and there's a virtual brake drag
param/MPC_THR_CURVE/longDesc: This parameter defines how the throttle stick input is mapped to commanded thrust in Manual/Stabilized flight mode. In case the default is used ('Rescale to hover thrust'), the stick input is linearly rescaled, such that a centered stick corresponds to the hover throttle (see MPC_THR_HOVER). Select 'No Rescale' to directly map the stick 1:1 to the output. This can be useful in case the hover thrust is very low and the default would lead to too much distortion (e.g. if hover thrust is set to 20%, 80% of the upper thrust range is squeezed into the upper half of the stick range). Note: In case MPC_THR_HOVER is set to 50%, the modes 0 and 1 are the same.
param/MPC_THR_HOVER/longDesc: Vertical thrust required to hover. This value is mapped to center stick for manual throttle control. With this value set to the thrust required to hover, transition from manual to Altitude or Position mode while hovering will occur with the throttle stick near center, which is then interpreted as (near) zero demand for vertical speed. This parameter is also important for the landing detection to work correctly.
param/MPC_THR_MAX/shortDesc: Maximum thrust in auto thrust control
param/MPC_THR_MIN/shortDesc: Minimum collective thrust in auto thrust control
param/MPC_THR_MIN/longDesc: It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust. Note: Without airmode zero thrust leads to zero roll/pitch control authority. (see MC_AIRMODE)
param/MPC_THR_XY_MARG/longDesc: Margin that is kept for horizontal control when prioritizing vertical thrust. To avoid completely starving horizontal control with high vertical error.
param/MPC_TILTMAX_AIR/longDesc: Limits maximum tilt in AUTO and POSCTRL modes during flight.
param/MPC_TILTMAX_LND/longDesc: Limits maximum tilt angle on landing.
param/MPC_TKO_RAMP_T/shortDesc: Position control smooth takeoff ramp time constant
param/MPC_TKO_RAMP_T/longDesc: Increasing this value will make automatic and manual takeoff slower. If it's too slow the drone might scratch the ground and tip over. A time constant of 0 disables the ramp
param/MPC_USE_HTE/longDesc: Set false to use the fixed parameter MPC_THR_HOVER Set true to use the value computed by the hover thrust estimator
param/MPC_VELD_LP/shortDesc: Low pass filter cut freq. for numerical velocity derivative
param/MPC_VEL_BACK_SC/shortDesc: Ratio between backward and forward maximum velocity
param/MPC_VEL_BACK_SC/longDesc: The maximum backward speed is defined by: MPC_VEL_BACK_SC * MPC_VEL_MANUAL
param/MPC_VEL_LAT_SC/shortDesc: Ratio between lateral and forward maximum velocity
param/MPC_VEL_LAT_SC/longDesc: The maximum lateral speed is defined by: MPC_VEL_LAT_SC * MPC_VEL_MANUAL
param/MPC_VEL_MANUAL/shortDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity setpoint for manual controlled mode
param/MPC_VEL_MANUAL/longDesc: If velocity setpoint larger than MPC_XY_VEL_MAX is set, then the setpoint will be capped to MPC_XY_VEL_MAX The maximum lateral and backward speed can be set as a fraction of this parameter using MPC_VEL_LAT_SC and MPC_VEL_BACK_SC, respectively.
param/MPC_XY_CRUISE/longDesc: Horizontal velocity used when flying autonomously in e.g. Missions, RTL, Goto.
param/MPC_XY_ERR_MAX/shortDesc: Maximum horizontal error allowed by the trajectory generator
param/MPC_XY_ERR_MAX/longDesc: The integration speed of the trajectory setpoint is linearly reduced with the horizontal position tracking error. When the error is above this parameter, the integration of the trajectory is stopped to wait for the drone. This value can be adjusted depending on the tracking capabilities of the vehicle.
param/MPC_XY_MAN_EXPO/shortDesc: Manual position control stick exponential curve sensitivity
param/MPC_XY_MAN_EXPO/longDesc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve
param/MPC_XY_P/shortDesc: Proportional gain for horizontal position error
param/MPC_XY_TRAJ_P/shortDesc: Proportional gain for horizontal trajectory position error
param/MPC_XY_VEL_ALL/longDesc: If set to a value greater than zero, other parameters are automatically set (such as MPC_XY_VEL_MAX or MPC_VEL_MANUAL). If set to a negative value, the existing individual parameters are used.
param/MPC_XY_VEL_D_ACC/shortDesc: Differential gain for horizontal velocity error. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again
param/MPC_XY_VEL_D_ACC/longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s^2 velocity derivative
param/MPC_XY_VEL_I_ACC/shortDesc: Integral gain for horizontal velocity error
param/MPC_XY_VEL_I_ACC/longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m velocity integral Non-zero value allows to eliminate steady state errors in the presence of disturbances like wind.
param/MPC_XY_VEL_MAX/longDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity in AUTO mode. If higher speeds are commanded in a mission they will be capped to this velocity.
param/MPC_XY_VEL_P_ACC/shortDesc: Proportional gain for horizontal velocity error
param/MPC_XY_VEL_P_ACC/longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s velocity error
param/MPC_YAW_EXPO/shortDesc: Manual control stick yaw rotation exponential curve
param/MPC_YAW_EXPO/longDesc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve
param/MPC_Z_MAN_EXPO/shortDesc: Manual control stick vertical exponential curve
param/MPC_Z_MAN_EXPO/longDesc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve
param/MPC_Z_P/shortDesc: Proportional gain for vertical position error
param/MPC_Z_VEL_ALL/longDesc: If set to a value greater than zero, other parameters are automatically set (such as MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_UP or MPC_LAND_SPEED). If set to a negative value, the existing individual parameters are used.
param/MPC_Z_VEL_D_ACC/shortDesc: Differential gain for vertical velocity error
param/MPC_Z_VEL_D_ACC/longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s^2 velocity derivative
param/MPC_Z_VEL_I_ACC/shortDesc: Integral gain for vertical velocity error
param/MPC_Z_VEL_I_ACC/longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m velocity integral Non zero value allows hovering thrust estimation on stabilized or autonomous takeoff.
param/MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_DN/longDesc: Descent velocity in manual modes and offboard. For auto modes, see MPC_Z_V_AUTO_DN
param/MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_UP/longDesc: Ascent velocity in manual modes and offboard. For auto modes, see MPC_Z_V_AUTO_UP
param/MPC_Z_VEL_P_ACC/shortDesc: Proportional gain for vertical velocity error
param/MPC_Z_VEL_P_ACC/longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s velocity error
param/MPC_Z_V_AUTO_DN/longDesc: Descent velocity in auto modes. For manual modes and offboard, see MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_DN
param/MPC_Z_V_AUTO_UP/longDesc: Ascent velocity in auto modes. For manual modes and offboard, see MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_UP
param/SYS_VEHICLE_RESP/longDesc: Changes the overall responsiveness of the vehicle. The higher the value, the faster the vehicle will react. If set to a value greater than zero, other parameters are automatically set (such as the acceleration or jerk limits). If set to a negative value, the existing individual parameters are used.
param/WV_ROLL_MIN/shortDesc: Minimum roll angle setpoint for weathervane controller to demand a yaw-rate
param/WV_YRATE_MAX/shortDesc: Maximum yawrate the weathervane controller is allowed to demand
param/MC_ACRO_EXPO/shortDesc: Acro mode Expo factor for Roll and Pitch
param/MC_ACRO_EXPO/longDesc: Exponential factor for tuning the input curve shape. 0 Purely linear input curve 1 Purely cubic input curve
param/MC_ACRO_EXPO_Y/shortDesc: Acro mode Expo factor for Yaw
param/MC_ACRO_EXPO_Y/longDesc: Exponential factor for tuning the input curve shape. 0 Purely linear input curve 1 Purely cubic input curve
param/MC_ACRO_SUPEXPO/shortDesc: Acro mode SuperExpo factor for Roll and Pitch
param/MC_ACRO_SUPEXPO/longDesc: SuperExpo factor for refining the input curve shape tuned using MC_ACRO_EXPO. 0 Pure Expo function 0.7 resonable shape enhancement for intuitive stick feel 0.95 very strong bent input curve only near maxima have effect
param/MC_ACRO_SUPEXPOY/shortDesc: Acro mode SuperExpo factor for Yaw
param/MC_ACRO_SUPEXPOY/longDesc: SuperExpo factor for refining the input curve shape tuned using MC_ACRO_EXPO_Y. 0 Pure Expo function 0.7 resonable shape enhancement for intuitive stick feel 0.95 very strong bent input curve only near maxima have effect
param/MC_BAT_SCALE_EN/longDesc: This compensates for voltage drop of the battery over time by attempting to normalize performance across the operating range of the battery. The copter should constantly behave as if it was fully charged with reduced max acceleration at lower battery percentages. i.e. if hover is at 0.5 throttle at 100% battery, it will still be 0.5 at 60% battery.
param/MC_PITCHRATE_D/longDesc: Pitch rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.
param/MC_PITCHRATE_I/longDesc: Pitch rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.
param/MC_PITCHRATE_K/longDesc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_PITCHRATE_K * (MC_PITCHRATE_P * error + MC_PITCHRATE_I * error_integral + MC_PITCHRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_PITCHRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_PITCHRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.
param/MC_PITCHRATE_P/longDesc: Pitch rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.
param/MC_PR_INT_LIM/longDesc: Pitch rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large pitch moment trim changes.
param/MC_ROLLRATE_D/longDesc: Roll rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.
param/MC_ROLLRATE_I/longDesc: Roll rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.
param/MC_ROLLRATE_K/longDesc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_ROLLRATE_K * (MC_ROLLRATE_P * error + MC_ROLLRATE_I * error_integral + MC_ROLLRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_ROLLRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_ROLLRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.
param/MC_ROLLRATE_P/longDesc: Roll rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.
param/MC_RR_INT_LIM/longDesc: Roll rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large roll moment trim changes.
param/MC_YAWRATE_D/longDesc: Yaw rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.
param/MC_YAWRATE_I/longDesc: Yaw rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.
param/MC_YAWRATE_K/longDesc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_YAWRATE_K * (MC_YAWRATE_P * error + MC_YAWRATE_I * error_integral + MC_YAWRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_YAWRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_YAWRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.
param/MC_YAWRATE_P/longDesc: Yaw rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.
param/MC_YR_INT_LIM/longDesc: Yaw rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large yaw moment trim changes.
param/OSD_ATXXXX_CFG/longDesc: Configure the ATXXXX OSD Chip (mounted on the OmnibusF4SD board) and select the transmission standard.
param/MOT_SLEW_MAX/shortDesc: Minimum motor rise time (slew rate limit)
param/MOT_SLEW_MAX/longDesc: Minimum time allowed for the motor input signal to pass through a range of 1000 PWM units. A value x means that the motor signal can only go from 1000 to 2000 PWM in minimum x seconds. Zero means that slew rate limiting is disabled.
param/PWM_SBUS_MODE/longDesc: Set to 1 to enable S.BUS version 1 output instead of RSSI.
param/THR_MDL_FAC/shortDesc: Thrust to motor control signal model parameter
param/THR_MDL_FAC/longDesc: Parameter used to model the nonlinear relationship between motor control signal (e.g. PWM) and static thrust. The model is: rel_thrust = factor * rel_signal^2 + (1-factor) * rel_signal, where rel_thrust is the normalized thrust between 0 and 1, and rel_signal is the relative motor control signal between 0 and 1.
param/PLD_BTOUT/longDesc: Time after which the landing target is considered lost without any new measurements.
param/PLD_FAPPR_ALT/longDesc: Allow final approach (without horizontal positioning) if losing landing target closer than this to the ground.
param/PLD_HACC_RAD/longDesc: Start descending if closer above landing target than this.
param/PLD_MAX_SRCH/longDesc: Maximum number of times to search for the landing target if it is lost during the precision landing.
param/PLD_SRCH_ALT/longDesc: Altitude above home to which to climb when searching for the landing target.
param/PLD_SRCH_TOUT/longDesc: Time allowed to search for the landing target before falling back to normal landing.
param/RC10_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC10_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC11_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC11_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC12_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC12_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC13_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC13_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC14_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC14_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC15_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC15_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC16_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC16_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC17_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC17_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC18_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC18_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC1_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC1_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (same as min for throttle)
param/RC2_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC2_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC3_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC3_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC4_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC4_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC5_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC5_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC6_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC6_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC7_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC7_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC8_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC8_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC9_DZ/longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
param/RC9_TRIM/longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).
param/RC_CHAN_CNT/longDesc: This parameter is used by Ground Station software to save the number of channels which were used during RC calibration. It is only meant for ground station use.
param/RC_FAILS_THR/longDesc: Use RC_MAP_FAILSAFE to specify which channel is used to indicate RC loss via this theshold. By default this is the throttle channel. Set to a PWM value slightly above the PWM value for the channel (e.g. throttle) in a failsafe event, but below the minimum PWM value for the channel during normal operation. Note: The default value of 0 disables the feature (it is below the expected range).
param/RC_MAP_FAILSAFE/longDesc: Configures which RC channel is used by the receiver to indicate the signal was lost (on receivers that use output a fixed signal value to report lost signal). If set to 0, the channel mapped to throttle is used. Use RC_FAILS_THR to set the threshold indicating lost signal. By default it's below the expected range and hence disabled.
param/RC_MAP_PARAM1/longDesc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 1st parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *
param/RC_MAP_PARAM2/longDesc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 2nd parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *
param/RC_MAP_PARAM3/longDesc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 3th parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *
param/RC_MAP_PITCH/longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading pitch inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.
param/RC_MAP_ROLL/longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading roll inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.
param/RC_MAP_THROTTLE/longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading throttle inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.
param/RC_MAP_YAW/longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading yaw inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.
param/RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN/shortDesc: PWM input channel that provides RSSI
param/RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN/longDesc: 0: do not read RSSI from input channel 1-18: read RSSI from specified input channel Specify the range for RSSI input with RC_RSSI_PWM_MIN and RC_RSSI_PWM_MAX parameters.
param/RC_RSSI_PWM_MAX/shortDesc: Max input value for RSSI reading
param/RC_RSSI_PWM_MIN/shortDesc: Min input value for RSSI reading
param/TRIM_PITCH/longDesc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.
param/TRIM_ROLL/longDesc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.
param/TRIM_YAW/longDesc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.
param/RC_ARMSWITCH_TH/longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th
param/RC_GEAR_TH/shortDesc: Threshold for the landing gear switch
param/RC_GEAR_TH/longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th
param/RC_KILLSWITCH_TH/longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th
param/RC_LOITER_TH/longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th
param/RC_MAP_ARM_SW/longDesc: Use it to arm/disarm via switch instead of default throttle stick. If this is assigned, arming and disarming via stick is disabled.
param/RC_MAP_FLTMODE/longDesc: If this parameter is non-zero, flight modes are only selected by this channel and are assigned to six slots.
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/0: Mask Channel 1 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/1: Mask Channel 2 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/2: Mask Channel 3 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/3: Mask Channel 4 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/4: Mask Channel 5 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/5: Mask Channel 6 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/6: Mask Channel 7 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/7: Mask Channel 8 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/8: Mask Channel 9 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/9: Mask Channel 10 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/10: Mask Channel 11 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/11: Mask Channel 12 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/12: Mask Channel 13 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/13: Mask Channel 14 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/14: Mask Channel 15 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/15: Mask Channel 16 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/16: Mask Channel 17 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/bitmask/17: Mask Channel 18 as a mode button
param/RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN/longDesc: This bitmask allows to specify multiple channels for changing flight modes using momentary buttons. Each channel is assigned to a mode slot ((lowest channel = slot 1). The resulting modes for each slot X is defined by the COM_FLTMODEX parameters. The functionality can be used only if RC_MAP_FLTMODE is disabled. The maximum number of available slots and hence bits set in the mask is 6.
param/RC_MAP_MODE_SW/longDesc: This is the main flight mode selector. The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for deciding about the main mode. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.
param/RC_OFFB_TH/longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th
param/RC_RETURN_TH/shortDesc: Threshold for selecting return to launch mode
param/RC_RETURN_TH/longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th
param/RC_TRANS_TH/shortDesc: Threshold for the VTOL transition switch
param/RC_TRANS_TH/longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th
param/RTL_CONE_ANG/values/0: No cone, always climb to RTL_RETURN_ALT above destination.
param/RTL_CONE_ANG/values/90: Only climb to at least RTL_DESCEND_ALT above destination.
param/RTL_CONE_ANG/shortDesc: Half-angle of the return mode altitude cone
param/RTL_CONE_ANG/longDesc: Defines the half-angle of a cone centered around the destination position that affects the altitude at which the vehicle returns.
param/RTL_DESCEND_ALT/longDesc: Descend to this altitude (above destination position) after return, and wait for time defined in RTL_LAND_DELAY. Land (i.e. slowly descend) from this altitude if autolanding allowed.
param/RTL_HDG_MD/longDesc: Defines the heading behavior during RTL
param/RTL_LAND_DELAY/longDesc: Delay before landing (after initial descent) in Return mode. If set to -1 the system will not land but loiter at RTL_DESCEND_ALT.
param/RTL_LOITER_RAD/longDesc: Set the radius for loitering to a safe altitude for VTOL transition.
param/RTL_MIN_DIST/shortDesc: Horizontal radius from return point within which special rules for return mode apply
param/RTL_MIN_DIST/longDesc: The return altitude will be calculated based on RTL_CONE_ANG parameter. The yaw setpoint will switch to the one defined by corresponding waypoint.
param/RTL_PLD_MD/longDesc: Use precision landing when doing an RTL landing phase.
param/RTL_RETURN_ALT/longDesc: Default minimum altitude above destination (e.g. home, safe point, landing pattern) for return flight. This is affected by RTL_MIN_DIST and RTL_CONE_ANG.
param/RTL_TYPE/values/0: Return to closest safe point (home or rally point) via direct path.
param/RTL_TYPE/values/1: Return to closest safe point other than home (mission landing pattern or rally point), via direct path. If no mission landing or rally points are defined return home via direct path. Always chose closest safe landing point if vehicle is a VTOL in hover mode.
param/RTL_TYPE/values/2: Return to a planned mission landing, if available, using the mission path, else return to home via the reverse mission path. Do not consider rally points.
param/RTL_TYPE/values/3: Return via direct path to closest destination: home, start of mission landing pattern or safe point. If the destination is a mission landing pattern, follow the pattern to land.
param/RTL_TYPE/longDesc: Return mode destination and flight path (home location, rally point, mission landing pattern, reverse mission)
param/RTL_TIME_FACTOR/shortDesc: RTL time estimate safety margin factor
param/RTL_TIME_FACTOR/longDesc: Safety factor that is used to scale the actual RTL time estiamte. Time with margin = RTL_TIME_FACTOR * time + RTL_TIME_MARGIN
param/RTL_TIME_MARGIN/shortDesc: RTL time estimate safety margin offset
param/RTL_TIME_MARGIN/longDesc: Margin that is added to the time estimate, after it has already been scaled Time with margin = RTL_TIME_FACTOR * time + RTL_TIME_MARGIN
param/RBCLW_ADDRESS/longDesc: The Roboclaw can be configured to have an address from 0x80 to 0x87, inclusive. It must be configured to match this parameter.
param/RBCLW_BAUD/longDesc: Baud rate of the serial communication with the Roboclaw. The Roboclaw must be configured to match this rate.
param/RBCLW_COUNTS_REV/longDesc: Number of encoder counts for one revolution. The roboclaw treats analog encoders (potentiometers) as having 2047 counts per rev. The default value of 1200 corresponds to the default configuration of the Aion R1 rover.
param/RBCLW_READ_PER/longDesc: How long to wait, in Milliseconds, between reading wheel encoder values over Uart from the Roboclaw
param/RBCLW_WRITE_PER/longDesc: How long to wait, in Milliseconds, between writing actuator controls over Uart to the Roboclaw
param/GND_L1_DIST/longDesc: This is the distance at which the next waypoint is activated. This should be set to about 2-4x of GND_WHEEL_BASE and not smaller than one meter (due to GPS accuracy).
param/GND_L1_PERIOD/longDesc: This is the L1 distance and defines the tracking point ahead of the rover it's following. Use values around 2-5m for a 0.3m wheel base. Tuning instructions: Shorten slowly during tuning until response is sharp without oscillation.
param/GND_MAX_ANG/shortDesc: Maximum turn angle for Ackerman steering
param/GND_MAX_ANG/longDesc: At a control output of 0, the steering wheels are at 0 radians. At a control output of 1, the steering wheels are at GND_MAX_ANG radians.
param/GND_SPEED_D/longDesc: This is the derivative gain for the speed closed loop controller
param/GND_SPEED_I/longDesc: This is the integral gain for the speed closed loop controller
param/GND_SPEED_IMAX/longDesc: This is the maxim value the integral can reach to prevent wind-up.
param/GND_SPEED_P/longDesc: This is the proportional gain for the speed closed loop controller
param/GND_SPEED_THR_SC/longDesc: This is a gain to map the speed control output to the throttle linearly.
param/GND_SP_CTRL_MODE/values/1: close the loop with gps speed
param/GND_SP_CTRL_MODE/longDesc: This allows the user to choose between closed loop gps speed or open loop cruise throttle speed
param/GND_THR_CRUISE/longDesc: This is the throttle setting required to achieve the desired cruise speed. 10% is ok for a traxxas stampede vxl with ESC set to training mode
param/GND_THR_MAX/longDesc: This is the maximum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For a Traxxas stampede vxl with the ESC set to training, 30 % is enough
param/GND_THR_MIN/longDesc: This is the minimum throttle % that can be used by the controller. Set to 0 for rover
param/GND_WHEEL_BASE/shortDesc: Distance from front axle to rear axle
param/GND_WHEEL_BASE/longDesc: A value of 0.31 is typical for 1/10 RC cars.
param/RWTO_AIRSPD_SCL/shortDesc: Min airspeed scaling factor for takeoff
param/RWTO_AIRSPD_SCL/longDesc: Pitch up will be commanded when the following airspeed is reached: FW_AIRSPD_MIN * RWTO_AIRSPD_SCL
param/RWTO_HDG/shortDesc: Specifies which heading should be held during runnway takeoff
param/RWTO_HDG/longDesc: 0: airframe heading, 1: heading towards takeoff waypoint
param/RWTO_MAX_PITCH/longDesc: Fixed-wing settings are used if set to 0. Note that there is also a minimum pitch of 10 degrees during takeoff, so this must be larger if set.
param/RWTO_MAX_ROLL/longDesc: Roll is limited during climbout to ensure enough lift and prevents aggressive navigation before we're on a safe height.
param/RWTO_MAX_THR/longDesc: Can be used to test taxi on runway
param/RWTO_NAV_ALT/shortDesc: Altitude AGL at which we have enough ground clearance to allow some roll
param/RWTO_NAV_ALT/longDesc: Until RWTO_NAV_ALT is reached the plane is held level and only rudder is used to keep the heading (see RWTO_HDG). This should be below FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF if FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF > 0.
param/RWTO_PSP/shortDesc: Pitch setpoint during taxi / before takeoff airspeed is reached
param/RWTO_PSP/longDesc: A taildragger with steerable wheel might need to pitch up a little to keep its wheel on the ground before airspeed to takeoff is reached.
param/RWTO_RAMP_TIME/shortDesc: Throttle ramp up time for runway takeoff
param/SDLOG_ALGORITHM/longDesc: Selects the algorithm used for logfile encryption
param/SDLOG_BOOT_BAT/longDesc: When enabled, logging will not start from boot if battery power is not detected (e.g. powered via USB on a test bench). This prevents extraneous flight logs from being created during bench testing. Note that this only applies to log-from-boot modes. This has no effect on arm-based modes.
param/SDLOG_DIRS_MAX/shortDesc: Maximum number of log directories to keep
param/SDLOG_DIRS_MAX/longDesc: If there are more log directories than this value, the system will delete the oldest directories during startup. In addition, the system will delete old logs if there is not enough free space left. The minimum amount is 300 MB. If this is set to 0, old directories will only be removed if the free space falls below the minimum. Note: this does not apply to mission log files.
param/SDLOG_EXCH_KEY/longDesc: If the logfile is encrypted using a symmetric key algorithm, the used encryption key is generated at logging start and stored on the sdcard RSA2048 encrypted using this key.
param/SDLOG_KEY/longDesc: Selects the key in keystore, used for encrypting the log. When using a symmetric encryption algorithm, the key is generated at logging start and kept stored in this index. For symmetric algorithms, the key is volatile and valid only for the duration of logging. The key is stored in encrypted format on the sdcard alongside the logfile, using an RSA2048 key defined by the SDLOG_EXCHANGE_KEY
param/SDLOG_MISSION/longDesc: If enabled, a small additional "mission" log file will be written to the SD card. The log contains just those messages that are useful for tasks like generating flight statistics and geotagging. The different modes can be used to further reduce the logged data (and thus the log file size). For example, choose geotagging mode to only log data required for geotagging. Note that the normal/full log is still created, and contains all the data in the mission log (and more).
param/SDLOG_MODE/longDesc: Determines when to start and stop logging. By default, logging is started when arming the system, and stopped when disarming.
param/SDLOG_PROFILE/longDesc: This integer bitmask controls the set and rates of logged topics. The default allows for general log analysis while keeping the log file size reasonably small. Enabling multiple sets leads to higher bandwidth requirements and larger log files. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Default set (used for general log analysis) 1 : Full rate estimator (EKF2) replay topics 2 : Topics for thermal calibration (high rate raw IMU and Baro sensor data) 3 : Topics for system identification (high rate actuator control and IMU data) 4 : Full rates for analysis of fast maneuvers (RC, attitude, rates and actuators) 5 : Debugging topics (debug_*.msg topics, for custom code) 6 : Topics for sensor comparison (low rate raw IMU, Baro and Magnetomer data) 7 : Topics for computer vision and collision avoidance 8 : Raw FIFO high-rate IMU (Gyro) 9 : Raw FIFO high-rate IMU (Accel)
param/SDLOG_UTC_OFFSET/longDesc: the difference in hours and minutes from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for a your place and date. for example, In case of South Korea(UTC+09:00), UTC offset is 540 min (9*60) refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_UTC_time_offsets
param/SDLOG_UUID/longDesc: If set to 1, add an ID to the log, which uniquely identifies the vehicle
param/SIM_BAT_MIN_PCT/longDesc: Can be used to alter the battery level during SITL- or HITL-simulation on the fly. Particularly useful for testing different low-battery behaviour.
param/SENS_DPRES_ANSC/longDesc: Pick the appropriate scaling from the datasheet. this number defines the (linear) conversion from voltage to Pascal (pa). For the MPXV7002DP this is 1000. NOTE: If the sensor always registers zero, try switching the static and dynamic tubes.
param/SENS_FLOW_MAXHGT/shortDesc: Maximum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
param/SENS_FLOW_MAXHGT/longDesc: This parameter defines the maximum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The height setpoint will be limited to be no greater than this value when the navigation system is completely reliant on optical flow data and the height above ground estimate is valid. The sensor may be usable above this height, but accuracy will progressively degrade.
param/SENS_FLOW_MAXR/shortDesc: Magnitude of maximum angular flow rate reliably measurable by the optical flow sensor
param/SENS_FLOW_MAXR/longDesc: Optical flow data will not fused by the estimators if the magnitude of the flow rate exceeds this value and control loops will be instructed to limit ground speed such that the flow rate produced by movement over ground is less than 50% of this value.
param/SENS_FLOW_MINHGT/shortDesc: Minimum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
param/SENS_FLOW_MINHGT/longDesc: This parameter defines the minimum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The sensor may be usable below this height, but accuracy will progressively reduce to loss of focus.
param/ADC_ADS1115_EN/longDesc: If enabled, the internal ADC is not used.
param/BAT1_C_MULT/shortDesc: Capacity/current multiplier for high-current capable SMBUS battery
param/CAL_AIR_CMODEL/shortDesc: Airspeed sensor compensation model for the SDP3x
param/CAL_AIR_CMODEL/longDesc: Model with Pitot CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Not used, 1.5 mm tubes assumed. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor. Model without Pitot (1.5 mm tubes) CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Not used, 1.5 mm tubes assumed. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor. Tube Pressure Drop CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Diameter in mm of the pitot and tubes, must have the same diameter. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor and the static + dynamic port length of the pitot.
param/CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM/shortDesc: Airspeed sensor tube diameter. Only used for the Tube Pressure Drop Compensation
param/CAL_AIR_TUBELEN/longDesc: See the CAL_AIR_CMODEL explanation on how this parameter should be set.
param/CAL_MAG_ROT_AUTO/longDesc: During calibration attempt to automatically determine the rotation of external magnetometers.
param/CAL_MAG_SIDES/shortDesc: Bitfield selecting mag sides for calibration
param/CAL_MAG_SIDES/longDesc: If set to two side calibration, only the offsets are estimated, the scale calibration is left unchanged. Thus an initial six side calibration is recommended. Bits: ORIENTATION_TAIL_DOWN = 1 ORIENTATION_NOSE_DOWN = 2 ORIENTATION_LEFT = 4 ORIENTATION_RIGHT = 8 ORIENTATION_UPSIDE_DOWN = 16 ORIENTATION_RIGHTSIDE_UP = 32
param/IMU_ACCEL_CUTOFF/shortDesc: Low pass filter cutoff frequency for accel
param/IMU_ACCEL_CUTOFF/longDesc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter on the primary accelerometer. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. 0 disables the filter.
param/IMU_DGYRO_CUTOFF/shortDesc: Cutoff frequency for angular acceleration (D-Term filter)
param/IMU_DGYRO_CUTOFF/longDesc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter used on the time derivative of the measured angular velocity, also known as the D-term filter in the rate controller. The D-term uses the derivative of the rate and thus is the most susceptible to noise. Therefore, using a D-term filter allows to increase IMU_GYRO_CUTOFF, which leads to reduced control latency and permits to increase the P gains. A value of 0 disables the filter.
param/IMU_GYRO_CUTOFF/shortDesc: Low pass filter cutoff frequency for gyro
param/IMU_GYRO_CUTOFF/longDesc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter on the primary gyro. This only affects the angular velocity sent to the controllers, not the estimators. It applies also to the angular acceleration (D-Term filter), see IMU_DGYRO_CUTOFF. A value of 0 disables the filter.
