param/IMU_GYRO_DNF_BW/shortDesc: IMU gyro ESC notch filter bandwidth
param/IMU_GYRO_DNF_BW/longDesc: Bandwidth per notch filter when using dynamic notch filtering with ESC RPM.
param/IMU_GYRO_DNF_EN/longDesc: Enable bank of dynamically updating notch filters. Requires ESC RPM feedback or onboard FFT (IMU_GYRO_FFT_EN).
param/IMU_GYRO_NF_BW/longDesc: The frequency width of the stop band for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. See "IMU_GYRO_NF_FREQ" to activate the filter and to set the notch frequency. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers.
param/IMU_GYRO_NF_FREQ/longDesc: The center frequency for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. This filter can be enabled to avoid feedback amplification of structural resonances at a specific frequency. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers. See "IMU_GYRO_NF_BW" to set the bandwidth of the filter. A value of 0 disables the filter.
param/IMU_GYRO_RATEMAX/shortDesc: Gyro control data maximum publication rate (inner loop rate)
param/IMU_GYRO_RATEMAX/longDesc: The maximum rate the gyro control data (vehicle_angular_velocity) will be allowed to publish at. This is the loop rate for the rate controller and outputs. Note: sensor data is always read and filtered at the full raw rate (eg commonly 8 kHz) regardless of this setting.
param/IMU_INTEG_RATE/longDesc: The rate at which raw IMU data is integrated to produce delta angles and delta velocities. Recommended to set this to a multiple of the estimator update period (currently 10 ms for ekf2).
param/PCF8583_MAGNET/longDesc: Nmumber of signals per rotation of actuator
param/PCF8583_POOL/longDesc: Determines how often the sensor is read out.
param/PCF8583_RESET/longDesc: Internal device counter is reset to 0 when overun this value, counter is able to store upto 6 digits reset of counter takes some time - measurement with reset has worse accurancy. 0 means reset counter after every measurement.
param/SENS_BARO_RATE/longDesc: Barometric air data maximum publication rate. This is an upper bound, actual barometric data rate is still dependant on the sensor.
param/SENS_BOARD_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the FMU board relative to the platform.
param/SENS_BOARD_X_OFF/longDesc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the X (Roll) axis It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.
param/SENS_BOARD_Y_OFF/longDesc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Y (Pitch) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.
param/SENS_BOARD_Z_OFF/longDesc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Z (Yaw) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.
param/SENS_EN_BATT/shortDesc: SMBUS Smart battery driver BQ40Z50 and BQ40Z80
param/SENS_EN_INA226/longDesc: For systems a INA226 Power Monitor, this should be set to true
param/SENS_EN_INA228/longDesc: For systems a INA228 Power Monitor, this should be set to true
param/SENS_EN_INA238/longDesc: For systems a INA238 Power Monitor, this should be set to true
param/SENS_EN_MS4525/shortDesc: TE MS4525 differential pressure sensor (external I2C)
param/SENS_EN_MS5525/shortDesc: TE MS5525 differential pressure sensor (external I2C)
param/SENS_EN_SDP3X/shortDesc: Sensirion SDP3X differential pressure sensor (external I2C)
param/SENS_EXT_I2C_PRB/longDesc: Probe for optional external I2C devices.
param/SENS_FLOW_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the yaw rotation of the PX4FLOW board relative to the vehicle body frame. Zero rotation is defined as X on flow board pointing towards front of vehicle. The recommneded installation default for the PX4FLOW board is with the Y axis forward (270 deg yaw).
param/SENS_GPS_MASK/longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to set which GPS accuracy metrics will be used to calculate the blending weight. Set to zero to disable and always used first GPS instance. 0 : Set to true to use speed accuracy 1 : Set to true to use horizontal position accuracy 2 : Set to true to use vertical position accuracy
param/SENS_GPS_PRIME/longDesc: When no blending is active, this defines the preferred GPS receiver instance. The GPS selection logic waits until the primary receiver is available to send data to the EKF even if a secondary instance is already available. The secondary instance is then only used if the primary one times out. To have an equal priority of all the instances, set this parameter to -1 and the best receiver will be used. This parameter has no effect if blending is active.
param/SENS_GPS_TAU/longDesc: Sets the longest time constant that will be applied to the calculation of GPS position and height offsets used to correct data from multiple GPS data for steady state position differences.
param/SENS_IMU_TEMP_I/shortDesc: IMU heater controller integrator gain value
param/SENS_IMU_TEMP_P/shortDesc: IMU heater controller proportional gain value
param/SENS_INT_BARO_EN/longDesc: For systems with an external barometer, this should be set to false to make sure that the external is used.
param/SENS_MAG_AUTOCAL/longDesc: Automatically initialize magnetometer calibration from bias estimate if available.
param/SENS_MAG_RATE/longDesc: Magnetometer data maximum publication rate. This is an upper bound, actual magnetometer data rate is still dependant on the sensor.
param/SENS_MB12_0_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MB12_10_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MB12_11_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MB12_1_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MB12_2_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MB12_3_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MB12_4_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MB12_5_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MB12_6_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MB12_7_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MB12_8_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MB12_9_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MPDT0_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MPDT10_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MPDT11_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MPDT1_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MPDT2_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MPDT3_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MPDT4_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MPDT5_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MPDT6_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MPDT7_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MPDT8_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_MPDT9_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.
param/SENS_OR_ADIS164X/shortDesc: Analog Devices ADIS16448 IMU Orientation(external SPI)
param/SENS_TEMP_ID/shortDesc: Target IMU device ID to regulate temperature
param/SIH_BARO_OFFSET/longDesc: Absolute value superior to 10000 will disable barometer
param/SIH_DISTSNSR_OVR/shortDesc: if >= 0 the distance sensor measures will be overrided by this value
param/SIH_DISTSNSR_OVR/longDesc: Absolute value superior to 10000 will disable distance sensor
param/SIH_IXX/longDesc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.
param/SIH_IXY/longDesc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.
param/SIH_IXZ/longDesc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.
param/SIH_IYY/longDesc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.
param/SIH_IYZ/longDesc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.
param/SIH_IZZ/longDesc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.
param/SIH_KDV/longDesc: Physical coefficient representing the friction with air particules. The greater this value, the slower the quad will move. Drag force function of velocity: D=-KDV*V. The maximum freefall velocity can be computed as V=10*MASS/KDV [m/s]
param/SIH_KDW/longDesc: Physical coefficient representing the friction with air particules during rotations. The greater this value, the slower the quad will rotate. Aerodynamic moment function of body rate: Ma=-KDW*W_B. This value can be set to 0 if unknown.
param/SIH_LOC_H0/longDesc: This value represents the Above Mean Sea Level (AMSL) altitude where the simulation begins. If using FlightGear as a visual animation, this value can be tweaked such that the vehicle lies on the ground at takeoff. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.
param/SIH_LOC_LAT0/longDesc: This value represents the North-South location on Earth where the simulation begins. A value of 45 deg should be written 450000000. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.
param/SIH_LOC_LON0/longDesc: This value represents the East-West location on Earth where the simulation begins. A value of 45 deg should be written 450000000. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.
param/SIH_LOC_MU_X/shortDesc: North magnetic field at the initial location
param/SIH_LOC_MU_X/longDesc: This value represents the North magnetic field at the initial location. A magnetic field calculator can be found on the NOAA website Note, the values need to be converted from nano Tesla to Gauss LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.
param/SIH_LOC_MU_Y/shortDesc: East magnetic field at the initial location
param/SIH_LOC_MU_Y/longDesc: This value represents the East magnetic field at the initial location. A magnetic field calculator can be found on the NOAA website Note, the values need to be converted from nano Tesla to Gauss LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.
param/SIH_LOC_MU_Z/shortDesc: Down magnetic field at the initial location
param/SIH_LOC_MU_Z/longDesc: This value represents the Down magnetic field at the initial location. A magnetic field calculator can be found on the NOAA website Note, the values need to be converted from nano Tesla to Gauss LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.
param/SIH_L_PITCH/longDesc: This is the arm length generating the pitching moment This value can be measured with a ruler. This corresponds to half the distance between the front and rear motors.
param/SIH_L_ROLL/longDesc: This is the arm length generating the rolling moment This value can be measured with a ruler. This corresponds to half the distance between the left and right motors.
param/SIH_MAG_OFFSET_X/longDesc: Absolute value superior to 10000 will disable magnetometer
param/SIH_MAG_OFFSET_Y/longDesc: Absolute value superior to 10000 will disable magnetometer
param/SIH_MAG_OFFSET_Z/longDesc: Absolute value superior to 10000 will disable magnetometer
param/SIH_MASS/longDesc: This value can be measured by weighting the quad on a scale.
param/SIH_Q_MAX/longDesc: This is the maximum torque delivered by one propeller when the motor is running at full speed. This value is usually about few percent of the maximum thrust force.
param/SIH_T_MAX/longDesc: This is the maximum force delivered by one propeller when the motor is running at full speed. This value is usually about 5 times the mass of the quadrotor.
param/SIH_T_TAU/longDesc: the time taken for the thruster to step from 0 to 100% should be about 4 times tau
param/SIM_GPS_USED/shortDesc: simulated GPS number of satellites used
param/SYS_AUTOCONFIG/longDesc: Set to 1 to reset parameters on next system startup (setting defaults). Platform-specific values are used if available. RC* parameters are preserved.
param/SYS_AUTOSTART/longDesc: CHANGING THIS VALUE REQUIRES A RESTART. Defines the auto-start script used to bootstrap the system.
param/SYS_BL_UPDATE/longDesc: If enabled, update the bootloader on the next boot. WARNING: do not cut the power during an update process, otherwise you will have to recover using some alternative method (e.g. JTAG). Instructions: - Insert an SD card - Enable this parameter - Reboot the board (plug the power or send a reboot command) - Wait until the board comes back up (or at least 2 minutes) - If it does not come back, check the file bootlog.txt on the SD card
param/SYS_CAL_ACCEL/shortDesc: Enable auto start of accelerometer thermal calibration at the next power up
param/SYS_CAL_ACCEL/longDesc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)
param/SYS_CAL_BARO/shortDesc: Enable auto start of barometer thermal calibration at the next power up
param/SYS_CAL_BARO/longDesc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)
param/SYS_CAL_GYRO/shortDesc: Enable auto start of rate gyro thermal calibration at the next power up
param/SYS_CAL_GYRO/longDesc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)
param/SYS_CAL_TDEL/shortDesc: Required temperature rise during thermal calibration
param/SYS_CAL_TDEL/longDesc: A temperature increase greater than this value is required during calibration. Calibration will complete for each sensor when the temperature increase above the starting temeprature exceeds the value set by SYS_CAL_TDEL. If the temperature rise is insufficient, the calibration will continue indefinitely and the board will need to be repowered to exit.
param/SYS_CAL_TMAX/shortDesc: Maximum starting temperature for thermal calibration
param/SYS_CAL_TMAX/longDesc: Temperature calibration will not start if the temperature of any sensor is higher than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMAX.
param/SYS_CAL_TMIN/shortDesc: Minimum starting temperature for thermal calibration
param/SYS_CAL_TMIN/longDesc: Temperature calibration for each sensor will ignore data if the temperature is lower than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMIN.
param/SYS_CTRL_ALLOC/longDesc: If disabled, the existing mixing implementation is used. If enabled, dynamic control allocation with runtime configuration of the mixing and output functions is used. Note: this is work-in-progress and not all vehicle types are supported yet.
param/SYS_FAC_CAL_MODE/longDesc: If enabled, future sensor calibrations will be stored to /fs/mtd_caldata. Note: this is only supported on boards with a separate calibration storage /fs/mtd_caldata.
param/SYS_FAILURE_EN/longDesc: If enabled allows MAVLink INJECT_FAILURE commands. WARNING: the failures can easily cause crashes and are to be used with caution!
param/SYS_HAS_BARO/shortDesc: Control if the vehicle has a barometer
param/SYS_HAS_BARO/longDesc: Disable this if the board has no barometer, such as some of the Omnibus F4 SD variants. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a barometer.
param/SYS_HAS_GPS/shortDesc: Control if the vehicle has a GPS
param/SYS_HAS_GPS/longDesc: Disable this if the system has no GPS. If disabled, the sensors hub will not process sensor_gps, and GPS will not be available for the rest of the system.
param/SYS_HAS_MAG/shortDesc: Control if the vehicle has a magnetometer
param/SYS_HAS_MAG/longDesc: Disable this if the board has no magnetometer, such as the Omnibus F4 SD. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a magnetometer.
param/SYS_HAS_NUM_DIST/shortDesc: Control the number of distance sensors on the vehicle
param/SYS_HAS_NUM_DIST/longDesc: If set to the number of distance sensors, the preflight check will check for their presence and valid data publication. Disable with 0 if no distance sensor present or to disbale the preflight check.
param/SYS_HITL/shortDesc: Enable HITL/SIH mode on next boot
param/SYS_HITL/longDesc: While enabled the system will boot in Hardware-In-The-Loop (HITL) or Simulation-In-Hardware (SIH) mode and not enable all sensors and checks. When disabled the same vehicle can be flown normally. Set to 'external HITL', if the system should perform as if it were a real vehicle (the only difference to a real system is then only the parameter value, which can be used for log analysis).
param/SYS_MC_EST_GROUP/longDesc: Set the group of estimators used for multicopters and VTOLs
param/SYS_RGB_MAXBRT/longDesc: Set to 0 to disable, 1 for maximum brightness
param/SYS_USE_IO/longDesc: Can be used to use a configure the use of the IO board.
param/TEL_BST_EN/longDesc: If true, the FMU will try to connect to Blacksheep telemetry on start up
param/TF_CHECK_DIST/longDesc: Look ahead distance the terrain follower will use to detect terrain violation.
param/TF_TERRAIN_EN/longDesc: If enabled, configures the terrain data grid spacing. The recommended value is 100m, or 50m on boards with enough RAM. Whenever the mission, home position or safe points change, terrain data is requested within a rectangular area that includes all of these points. This will then be used during RTL. Note: - this feature requres several KB of RAM. - latitudes beyond +-80 degrees are not supported.
param/TF_TERR_DIST_MAX/shortDesc: Terrain follower maximum distance to terrain
param/TF_TERR_DIST_MIN/shortDesc: Terrain follower minimum distance to terrain

param/CANNODE_FLOW_ROT/longDesc: This parameter defines the yaw rotation of the Cannode flow board relative to the vehicle body frame. Zero rotation is defined as X on flow board pointing towards front of vehicle.
param/CANNODE_NODE_ID/longDesc: Read the specs at http://uavcan.org to learn more about Node ID.
param/UAVCAN_ENABLE/longDesc: 0 - UAVCAN disabled. 1 - Enables support for UAVCAN sensors without dynamic node ID allocation and firmware update. 2 - Enables support for UAVCAN sensors with dynamic node ID allocation and firmware update. 3 - Enables support for UAVCAN sensors and actuators with dynamic node ID allocation and firmware update. Also sets the motor control outputs to UAVCAN.
param/UAVCAN_ESC_IDLT/shortDesc: UAVCAN ESC will spin at specified idle throttle when armed, even if the mixer outputs zero setpoints
param/UAVCAN_LGT_ANTCL/longDesc: This parameter defines the minimum condition under which the system will command the ANTI_COLLISION lights on 0 - Always off 1 - When autopilot is armed 2 - When autopilot is prearmed 3 - Always on
param/UAVCAN_LGT_LAND/longDesc: This parameter defines the minimum condition under which the system will command the LIGHT_ID_LANDING lights on 0 - Always off 1 - When autopilot is armed 2 - When autopilot is prearmed 3 - Always on
param/UAVCAN_LGT_NAV/longDesc: This parameter defines the minimum condition under which the system will command the RIGHT_OF_WAY lights on 0 - Always off 1 - When autopilot is armed 2 - When autopilot is prearmed 3 - Always on
param/UAVCAN_LGT_STROB/longDesc: This parameter defines the minimum condition under which the system will command the STROBE lights on 0 - Always off 1 - When autopilot is armed 2 - When autopilot is prearmed 3 - Always on
param/UAVCAN_NODE_ID/longDesc: Read the specs at http://uavcan.org to learn more about Node ID.
param/UAVCAN_RNG_MAX/longDesc: This parameter defines the maximum valid range for a rangefinder connected via UAVCAN.
param/UAVCAN_RNG_MIN/longDesc: This parameter defines the minimum valid range for a rangefinder connected via UAVCAN.
param/UAVCAN_SUB_BAT/longDesc: Enable UAVCAN battery subscription. 1) uavcan::equipment::power::BatteryInfo 2) cuav::equipment::power::CBAT
param/UAVCAN_SUB_DPRES/longDesc: Enable UAVCAN differential pressure subscription. uavcan::equipment::air_data::RawAirData
param/UAVCAN_SUB_GPS/longDesc: Enable UAVCAN GPS subscriptions. uavcan::equipment::gnss::Fix uavcan::equipment::gnss::Fix2 uavcan::equipment::gnss::Auxiliary
param/UAVCAN_SUB_ICE/longDesc: Enable UAVCAN internal combusion engine (ICE) subscription. uavcan::equipment::ice::reciprocating::Status
param/UCAN1_ACTR_PUB/shortDesc: actuator_outputs uORB over UAVCAN v1 publication port ID
param/UCAN1_BMS_BP_SUB/shortDesc: DS-015 battery parameters subscription  port ID
param/UCAN1_BMS_BS_SUB/shortDesc: DS-015 battery status subscription port ID
param/UCAN1_BMS_ES_SUB/shortDesc: DS-015 battery energy source subscription port ID
param/UCAN1_ESC_PUB/shortDesc: UAVCAN v1 ESC publication port ID
param/UCAN1_GPS_PUB/shortDesc: UAVCAN v1 GPS publication port ID
param/UCAN1_LG_BMS_SUB/shortDesc: UAVCAN v1 leagcy battery port ID
param/UCAN1_SERVO_PUB/shortDesc: UAVCAN v1 Servo publication port ID
param/UCAN1_UORB_GPS/shortDesc: sensor_gps uORB over UAVCAN v1 subscription port ID
param/UCAN1_UORB_GPS_P/shortDesc: sensor_gps uORB over UAVCAN v1 publication port ID
param/UAVCAN_V1_ID/longDesc: Read the specs at http://uavcan.org to learn more about Node ID.
param/VT_ARSP_BLEND/longDesc: Airspeed at which we can start blending both fw and mc controls. Set to 0 to disable.
param/VT_ARSP_TRANS/longDesc: Airspeed at which we can switch to fw mode
param/VT_B_DEC_FF/shortDesc: Backtransition deceleration setpoint to pitch feedforward gain
param/VT_B_DEC_I/shortDesc: Backtransition deceleration setpoint to pitch I gain
param/VT_B_DEC_MSS/longDesc: The approximate deceleration during a back transition in m/s/s Used to calculate back transition distance in mission mode. A lower value will make the VTOL transition further from the destination waypoint. For standard vtol and tiltrotors a controller is used to track this value during the transition.
param/VT_B_REV_DEL/shortDesc: Delay in seconds before applying back transition throttle
param/VT_B_REV_DEL/longDesc: Set this to a value greater than 0 to give the motor time to spin down. unit s
param/VT_B_REV_OUT/shortDesc: Output on airbrakes channel during back transition
param/VT_B_REV_OUT/longDesc: Used for airbrakes or with ESCs that have reverse thrust enabled on a seperate channel Airbrakes need to be enables for your selected model/mixer
param/VT_B_TRANS_DUR/longDesc: Time in seconds used for a back transition
param/VT_B_TRANS_RAMP/shortDesc: Back transition MC motor ramp up time
param/VT_B_TRANS_RAMP/longDesc: This sets the duration during which the MC motors ramp up to the commanded thrust during the back transition stage.
param/VT_B_TRANS_THR/shortDesc: Target throttle value for the transition to hover flight
param/VT_B_TRANS_THR/longDesc: standard vtol: pusher tailsitter, tiltrotor: main throttle Note for standard vtol: For ESCs and mixers that support reverse thrust on low PWM values set this to a negative value to apply active breaking For ESCs that support thrust reversal with a control channel please set VT_B_REV_OUT and set this to a positive value to apply active breaking
param/VT_ELEV_COMP_K/shortDesc: Pitch actuator compensation when alternative motor is on
param/VT_ELEV_COMP_OFF/shortDesc: Static offset added to the elevator control as part of the non-zero thrust line offset compensation for the alternate motor
param/VT_ELEV_MC_LOCK/longDesc: If set to 1 the control surfaces are locked at the disarmed value in multicopter mode.
param/VT_FWD_THRUST_EN/values/0: Disable FW forward actuation in hover.
param/VT_FWD_THRUST_EN/values/1: Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes (except LANDING).
param/VT_FWD_THRUST_EN/values/2: Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT1.
param/VT_FWD_THRUST_EN/values/3: Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT2.
param/VT_FWD_THRUST_EN/values/4: Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes.
param/VT_FWD_THRUST_EN/values/5: Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT1 (except LANDING).
param/VT_FWD_THRUST_EN/values/6: Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT2 (except LANDING).
param/VT_FWD_THRUST_EN/shortDesc: Enable/disable usage of fixed-wing actuators in hover to generate forward force (instead of pitching down)
param/VT_FWD_THRUST_EN/longDesc: This technique can be used to avoid the plane having to pitch down in order to move forward. This prevents large, negative lift values being created when facing strong winds. Fixed-wing forward actuators refers to puller/pusher (standard VTOL), or forward-tilt (tiltrotor VTOL). Only active if demaded down pitch is below VT_PITCH_MIN, and uses VT_FWD_THRUST_SC to get from demanded down pitch to fixed-wing actuation.
param/VT_FWD_THRUST_SC/shortDesc: Fixed-wing actuator thrust scale for hover forward flight
param/VT_FWD_THRUST_SC/longDesc: Scale applied to the demanded down-pitch to get the fixed-wing forward actuation in hover mode. Only active if demaded down pitch is below VT_PITCH_MIN. Enabled via VT_FWD_THRUST_EN.
param/VT_FW_ALT_ERR/longDesc: Maximum negative altitude error for fixed wing flight. If the altitude drops below this value below the altitude setpoint the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL.
param/VT_FW_DIFTHR_EN/longDesc: Set to 1 to enable differential thrust in fixed-wing flight.
param/VT_FW_DIFTHR_SC/longDesc: This factor specifies how the yaw input gets mapped to differential thrust in forwards flight.
param/VT_FW_MIN_ALT/longDesc: Minimum altitude for fixed wing flight, when in fixed wing the altitude drops below this altitude the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL
param/VT_FW_MOT_OFFID/shortDesc: The channel number of motors that must be turned off in fixed wing mode
param/VT_FW_PERM_STAB/longDesc: If set to one this parameter will cause permanent attitude stabilization in fw mode. This parameter has been introduced for pure convenience sake.
param/VT_FW_QC_P/longDesc: Maximum pitch angle before QuadChute engages Above this the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL
param/VT_FW_QC_R/longDesc: Maximum roll angle before QuadChute engages Above this the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL
param/VT_F_TRANS_DUR/longDesc: Time in seconds used for a transition
param/VT_F_TRANS_THR/shortDesc: Target throttle value for the transition to fixed wing flight
param/VT_F_TRANS_THR/longDesc: standard vtol: pusher tailsitter, tiltrotor: main throttle
param/VT_F_TR_OL_TM/shortDesc: Airspeed less front transition time (open loop)
param/VT_F_TR_OL_TM/longDesc: The duration of the front transition when there is no airspeed feedback available.
param/VT_IDLE_PWM_MC/shortDesc: Idle speed of VTOL when in multicopter mode
param/VT_LND_PTCH_MIN/shortDesc: Minimum pitch angle during hover landing
param/VT_LND_PTCH_MIN/longDesc: Overrides  VT_PTCH_MIN when the vehicle is in LAND mode (hovering). During landing it can be beneficial to allow lower minimum pitch angles as it can avoid the wings generating too much lift and preventing the vehicle from sinking at the desired rate.
param/VT_MC_ON_FMU/shortDesc: Enable the usage of AUX outputs for hover motors
param/VT_MC_ON_FMU/longDesc: Set this parameter to true if the vehicle's hover motors are connected to the FMU (AUX) port. Not required for boards that only have a FMU, and no IO. Only applies for standard VTOL and tiltrotor.
param/VT_MOT_ID/shortDesc: The channel number of motors which provide lift during hover
param/VT_PSHER_RMP_DT/longDesc: Defines the time window during which the pusher throttle will be ramped up linearly to VT_F_TRANS_THR during a transition to fixed wing mode. Zero or negative values will produce an instant throttle rise to VT_F_TRANS_THR.
param/VT_PTCH_MIN/longDesc: Minimum pitch angle during hover flight. If the desired pitch angle is is lower than this value then the fixed-wing forward actuation can be used to compensate for the missing thrust in forward direction (see VT_FW_TRHUST_EN)
param/VT_THR_ALTER_OFF/shortDesc: Throttle threshold to switch off alternative motor
param/VT_THR_ALTER_OFF/longDesc: The alternative fixed-wing motors are switched off if the throttle setpoint raises above this threshold.
param/VT_THR_ALTER_ON/shortDesc: Throttle threshold to switch on alternative motor
param/VT_THR_ALTER_ON/longDesc: The alternative fixed-wing motors are switched on if the throttle setpoint falls below this threshold.
param/VT_THR_ALTER_SC/shortDesc: Scle factor for alternative throttle. Used for throttle scaling in case alternative throttle is used
param/VT_THR_N_ALTER/shortDesc: Neutral throttle of alternative motors. Used for throttle scaling in case alternative throttle is used
param/VT_THR_N_MAIN/shortDesc: Neutral throttle of main motors. Used for throttle scaling in case alternative throttle is used
param/VT_TILT_FW/shortDesc: Position of tilt servo in fw mode
param/VT_TILT_MC/shortDesc: Position of tilt servo in mc mode
param/VT_TILT_SPINUP/shortDesc: Tilt actuator control value commanded when disarmed and during the first second after arming
param/VT_TILT_SPINUP/longDesc: This specific tilt during spin-up is necessary for some systems whose motors otherwise don't spin-up freely.
param/VT_TILT_TRANS/shortDesc: Position of tilt servo in transition mode
param/VT_TRANS_MIN_TM/longDesc: Minimum time in seconds for front transition.
param/VT_TRANS_P2_DUR/longDesc: Time in seconds it should take for the rotors to rotate forward completely from the point when the plane has picked up enough airspeed and is ready to go into fixed wind mode.
param/VT_TRANS_TIMEOUT/longDesc: Time in seconds after which transition will be cancelled. Disabled if set to 0.
param/WV_GAIN/longDesc: The desired gain to convert roll sp into yaw rate sp.
param/VTO_LOITER_ALT/longDesc: Altitude relative to home at which vehicle will loiter after front transition.
param/UUV_SKIP_CTRL/values/1: skip the controller and feedthrough the setpoints
